{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3543324,"name":"","username":"AndriesCMfgA","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/3ab097/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-28T09:08:16.974Z","cooked":"

Hi, sorry if this is a silly question, but I faced a lot of trouble with it last year and was hoping for some insight. Does periodic run during the autonomous period? Or is that what AutonomousPeriodic does? I ask because last year i had a PID controlling the angle of a hood, and then using pathplanner I called a command to change the setpoint to the desired value, however the PID controlling the motor speed that i placed in the periodic function would not update. I had to basically paste in the entire periodic function into the command and it forced me to run every command sequentially instead of some in parallel like i wanted.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-02-28T09:09:49.641Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":78,"readers_count":77,"score":60.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":493601,"topic_slug":"periodic-in-autonomous-help","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55039,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/periodic-in-autonomous-help/493601/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3543378,"name":"icemannie","username":"icemannie","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/bc79bd/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-28T12:31:21.845Z","cooked":"

Robot.periodic() runs all the time. You can prove it to yourself by adding in Robot
private int per=0;
Then in periodic()
SmartDashboard .put Number(“periodic”, per++);
The others only run when in their mode. Try that too.

You shouldn’t be doing actions like you mention in Robot. That’s where Subsystems and Commands are used.

??? I didnt have any of that in Robot. It was in the subsystems periodic method. Is that still no good?

if you are using a command-based robot I believe that the subsystem.periodic() methods are called during robot.periodic()
either way the periodic() method of a subsystem runs during all robot modes (including when disabled which can cause some bugs if you don’t realize this)

The issue you’re describing here sounds closer to an issue with either command requirements or how the commands were communicating with the subsystem.
Could you explain in more detail how the subsystem took in inputs and what they ran?

the way we write our subsystems is that the public methods don’t tell the motor to move, instead they modify local variables (aka fields) that the periodic method handles and turns into motor outputs.

Hope this helps!
